channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Don't Wait for the Next Big Data Breach to Freeze Your Credit
item.description: Freezing your credit is a simple and free protection from identity thieves with few downsides.

item.title: Is the stock market open on Labor Day? Will Costco be closed?
item.description: The September holiday is the last big hurrah of summer, but that also means many businesses and offices won’t be operating as per usual.

item.title: Nestlé Has the Right Recipe
item.description: The global food giant’s drama at the top obscures a solid strategy and cheap shares.

item.title: Bank of America sees potential for a reversal in bond yields
item.description: Strategists at Bank of America says there’s a potential for a reversal in bond yields, particularly at the long end.

item.title: Budget Airlines Want to Go Premium. That's Easier Said Than Done.
item.description: Floundering low-cost carriers are trying to appeal to higher spenders—but pivoting away from a no-frills brand comes with perils.

item.title: Do policy makers have a ‘death wish’ for the U.S. dollar?
item.description: The greenback’s special status is a “huge advantage” that feels like it’s being thrown away, one strategist notes.

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Series
item.description: Check out the stocks Heard on the Street writers favor in their eighth annual stock-picking contest.

item.title: September is the market’s cruelest month — except in presidential election years
item.description: Plus: 5 sectors and 9 stocks to keep on your portfolio’s radar.

item.title: The Alleged Kickback Schemes That Inflated Costs for Home Buyers
item.description: The District of Columbia settled with four title companies over close ties with real-estate agents.

item.title: The ‘Low-Wage 100’ spend more on share buybacks that enrich executives than on their businesses. Lawmakers are taking note.
item.description: A new report on the 100 S&P 500 companies with the lowest median pay finds the buyback machine is still in overdrive.
